Honey and lemon: Honey has natural antibacterial and anti-inflammatory properties, while lemon is rich in vitamin C, which can help boost the immune system. Mixing honey and lemon in warm water and drinking it several times a day can help alleviate symptoms of a cold.
Garlic: Garlic is known for its immune-boosting properties. Consuming garlic in various forms, such as raw, cooked, or in supplements, can help fight off colds and other infections.
Rest and hydration: Getting enough rest and staying hydrated is crucial for fighting off colds. This can your body's natural defenses and allow it to recover more quickly.

Ginger tea: Ginger has natural anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties, which can help alleviate symptoms such as sore throat and congestion. Drinking ginger tea several times a day can help soothe the throat and ease symptoms.

Probiotics: Probiotics are live bacteria and yeasts that are beneficial for gut health. They can help boost the immune system and fight off infections, including colds. Consuming probiotics such as yogurt or kefir can help alleviate symptoms of a cold.
